overview: Students undertake a research project over the year, thereby gaining experience in posing research questions, searching the literature and in using basic research method for collecting and analysing data and presenting the results in a competently written research project and in a concise oral presentation. Regular meetings will be held with the supervisor during the year for gaining advice on the topic and on technical matters.
intended learning outcomes: Plan and conduct an individual research project using appropiate research methodologies
Present the results of their research orally and in writing.

additional pre-requisite: Note: the following subject/s can also be taken concurrently (at the same time)

assessments.description: Literature review plus research proposal. 5000 words
A 15-minute talk (includes 5 minutes of question time) on research proposal and update on progress. 15 minutes. Hurdle requirement:. Successful completion of the 15 minute talk task.

assessments.timing: Due before last day of Semester 2

Semester 1.Contact hours: This subject is an individual research project and weekly contact hours will vary depending on the nature of the project.
